narrator_text: ʔaǰɛčxʷot is often translated as "How are you?". A literal translation would word it as "Are you well?", but it is used in conversation with the same function as "How are you?"
ʔimot can be used as an expression of gratitude in casual conversation. A literal translation is "very good". The mot suffix is a common way of emphasizing a word in ayajuthem.
